meanings.sent1: The constant use of the knife was dulling its blade.
meanings.sent2: The pencil tip was dulling with each sketch.
meanings.sent3: The sword, tired of battle, joked about dulling itself to avoid more fights.
meanings.sent4: The memories of the past were slowly dulling the pain in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The monotonous routine was dulling his mind to creativity.

meanings.definition: Make or become less intense or lively
meanings.sent1: The rain was dulling the vibrant colors of the painting.
meanings.sent2: The music gradually dulled as the party came to an end.
meanings.sent3: The energetic puppy was dulling the calm atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent4: The excitement of the crowd dulled as the show went on.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of the city were dulling her senses after living in the countryside.
